title: Will i assume my mom's debt if i sponsor her i-130 & i-485?
question: My Mom comes here on a self sponsored tourist visa. One one of her visits she needed surgery and insurance didn't pay so now she has debt. I am leaning towards filing her i-130 & i-485 adjustment now that she's here as she gets very lonely in home country. Will i assume her debt if i do this without her filiing bankruptcy first? I definitely don't want to do that as that will mean me and my wife lose our hose and cars and start fresh.
answers: A US citizen does not acquire one's parent's medical debt if sponsor their i-130 & i-485

Filing an I-130 (immigrant petition) and an I-864 (affidavit of support) does not do anything to transfer civil/ personal debt. The I-864 however does state that if your mom takes any form of means-tested non-emergency benefits, you can be asked to reimburse the US government for those benefits. If you have any additional questions about this, connect with qualified US immigration counsel.

A sponsor may be required to reimburse the government if the sponsored alien (i.e. foreign national) becomes a public charge. It does not appear that this is case with your mother's medical debt. For more information, consult an immigration lawyer.
